name: Cardolon [DELUXE]
description:
Cardolon is a turn-based card game featuring strategy elements, where you must prevent the destruction of London using the eight elemental cards, the four from the [1666] version, and four new cards for the [DELUXE] version. Rather than earning a score as the game goes along, you start off with as high a score as you can ever get. At the start, all tiles are worth 100 points. As a tile burns or is destroyed in some other manner, it's worth slowly decreases. At the start of each turn, it is possible for a special event to occur, such as a dragon attack or the river flooding

DELUXE FEATURES:
  • Four elemental cards, in addition to the four original cards:
    • Ice - Freeze a group of tiles, preventing the fire from spreading there, and turning into water tiles upon melting
    • Lightning - Burns a single tile
    • Tempest - Changes the wind direction in a different way to the Wind element.
    • Time - Can revert a 3*3 square of tiles to their initial state. Only usable once per game.
  • A total of 4 maps:
    • London, brought back from the [1666] version
    • 3 new maps: Paris, Venice, and Bristol
  • New event:
    • Meteor - Strikes the ground, turning the hit tile into an earth tile, and all surrounding tiles into fire tiles.
  • New display options that can be toggled in game:
    • Press SPACE to turn on/off the score display, which shows the score currently granted by each tile (WARNING: lags the game a lot)
    • Press RETURN to swap to the simple display, which removes the background map and fire sprites.
  • New menus:
    • A remade tutorial
    • In-game pause menu
    • Map select menu
CONTROLS:
  • Mouse Motion - Movement in the menu / game
  • Left Click - Selection in the menu / game
  • Right Click - Deselection
  • On-screen button - Discard the selected card
  • ESCAPE - Open the pause menu
  • SPACE, RETURN - Toggle graphics settings in-game
ASSETS USED:
  • Pixel UI Pack - Kenney
  • Kenney Font Package - Kenney
  • Medieval Sharp Font - Wojciech Kalinowski
  • Fire - Spring
  • Compass Rose - Pace Smith (based on Windrose by Prushik)
  • Medieval Loop - Remaxim
  • Spell 4 (fire) - Bart K.
